description: A divided US Supreme Court let President Donald Trump resume using a wartime law to try to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members, giving the administration a boost in a high-profile clash over the limits of presidential power.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Use Wartime Law to Seek Deportations

description: Japanese stocks are set to rise after declines in US equities were limited overnight and President Donald Trump assigned officials to kick off bilateral trade talks with the Asian nation.
title: Japan Stocks Set to Rebound on Limited US Loss, Trade Talks

description: House Freedom Caucus Chairman Andy Harris says he is open to the creation of a new 40% tax bracket for those earning $1 million or more, lending credence to an idea Republicans are considering as a way to offset some new tax cuts.
title: Republicans Warm to Millionaire Tax Hike to Pay for Levy Cuts

description: Senator Elizabeth Warren lashed out at President Donald Trump’s sweeping global tariffs, saying they risk throwing millions of Americans out of work.
title: Warren Rips Trump’s ‘Dumbest’ Trade War, Nods to Tariffs as Tool

description: US immigration authorities have revoked a spate of student visas for foreign nationals at major colleges including Harvard, Tufts and Stanford, in a growing number of cases that have raised concern among campus officials.
title: US Is Quietly Revoking Student Visas From Harvard to Stanford

description: Why are Japanese streets empty of US cars? It’s no mystery — they're not good enough.
title: The Japan Tariff Myth That Just Won’t Die

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Keeping Up With Market Turmoil and Trump’s Tariff Moves

description: Senate Republican leader John Thune predicted a bipartisan bill that would give lawmakers greater oversight of President Donald Trump’s tariffs would languish in Congress.
title: GOP’s Thune Says Bill Curbing Trump Tariff Power Has No Future

description: Ethan Penner, a real estate investor credited with pioneering commercial mortgage-backed securities, said he’s considering running for California governor in 2026, joining a growing field of candidates vying to replace term-limited Democrat Gavin Newsom.
title: CMBS Pioneer Ethan Penner Considers Run for California Governor

description: The US chief justice temporarily paused an order requiring President Donald Trump’s administration to bring back a Maryland man who immigration officials conceded was wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.
title: Chief Justice Pauses Order to Return Wrongfully Deported Man

description: President Donald Trump said the US is holding direct talks with Iran and the next round will take place this Saturday “at almost the highest level,” provoking confusion after the leaders in Tehran rejected the idea and proposed negotiations with Oman as mediator.
title: Trump Says US Is Having Direct Talks as Iran Rejects Them

description: President Donald Trump said he wasn’t considering a pause on his plan to implement sweeping additional tariffs on dozens of countries despite outreach from trading partners eager to avoid the levies, while still signaling he could be open to some negotiations.
title: Trump Says No Pause on Tariffs, But Open to Negotiations

description: Senator Ted Cruz extended his critique of President Donald Trump’s tariffs and said there are “angels and demons” vying for influence as the White House plans to impose the steepest US trade duties in more than a century.
title: Ted Cruz Urges Trump to Listen to ‘Angel’ Elon Musk on Trade

description: Trump administration officials are debating the merits of creating a new exporter tax credit, a move that offers an implicit acknowledgment of the harm that the White House’s tariff policies risk inflicting on US companies.
title: Trump Team Considers Exporter Tax Credit as Tariff Counterweight

description: Business are already making moves.
title: What Trump's Tariffs Are Already Doing to World Trade

description: It was just last Wednesday that President Trump announced his new tariff schedule with the rest of the world. And it’s already having an effect. Companies are scrambling to get goods on planes or boats to beat the first deadline. Companies are already trying to get out of existing contracts. And some previously planned factory endeavors have even been put on hold. On this episode, we speak with Ryan Petersen, the founder and CEO of Flexport, to talk about what he’s already seeing from the perspe
title: Odd Lots: Trump’s Tariffs Are Already Impacting Trade (Podcast)

description: The European Union is proposing 25% tariffs on a selection of US goods in retaliation for President Donald Trump’s decision last month to put levies on aluminum and steel imports.
title: EU Considers 25% Tariffs on Some US Goods in Metals Dispute

description: Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency staff will be able to access personal information of millions of US union members at the Education Department and the government’s human resources arm under a federal appeals court order.
title: Appeals Court Lifts Some Limits on DOGE Access at US Agencies

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said Donald Trump’s tariff policy is an act of economic self-sabotage that’s pushing the US into a downturn.
title: Trump’s Trade War Is Driving US Into Recession, Canada’s Carney Says

description: India will restrict market access to BYD Co. even as it courts investments from US rival Tesla Inc., showing New Delhi’s lingering angst with China despite recent signs of a thaw in relationship.
title: India Says ‘No’ to BYD While Wooing Rival Tesla to Invest

description: The leader of Canada’s Conservative Party said he would accelerate approval on 10 resource projects if elected, including the extension of a major Suncor Energy Inc. oil sands mine in Alberta.
title: Canada’s Poilievre Says He Would Approve Suncor Oil Project, Mines

description: South Africa’s Democratic Alliance is deeply divided about staying in the country’s ruling coalition following a standoff over the budget.
title: South Africa’s DA Split as It Weighs Leaving Governing Coalition

description: President Donald Trump threatened to “impose ADDITIONAL Tariffs on China of 50%” unless Beijing withdraws a 34% retaliatory duty on US goods.
title: Trump Threatens Additional 50% China Tariff Over Retaliation

description: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court to block an order requiring the government to bring back a Maryland man who immigration officials conceded was wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.
title: Trump Turns to Supreme Court on Maryland Man Deported in Error

description: European Union countries agree all available tools may be used as threats in talks with the US on President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to French Trade Minister Laurent Saint-Martin.
title: France Says EU Ready to Brandish All Tools in US Trade Talks

description: President Donald Trump ordered a review of the potential sale of United States Steel Corp. to Nippon Steel Corp., opening the door to amend a decision by his predecessor, Joe Biden, to block the transaction.
title: Trump Directs Security Panel to Review US Steel Deal

description: The public health agency of the African Union, which oversees the continent’s response to disease outbreaks, said governments will need to turn to taxes and the private sector to fill the hole left by the cancellation of billions of dollars of American aid.
title: Trump Cuts See Main African Health Agency Turn to Local Funding

description: European Union trade ministers closed ranks and signaled readiness to deploy a full spectrum of countermeasures including potential taxes on digital companies in response to US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs.
title: EU Trade Chiefs Close Ranks as Trump Tariffs Jolt Global Trade

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves told UK automakers that the government will support them after US President Donald Trump’s tariffs last week sent the industry into turmoil.
title: UK Tells Automakers ‘We Have Your Back’ After Trump Tariffs Hit

description: The European Union will set up an import surveillance task force to monitor potential diversion of goods as a result of US tariffs as it tries to pursue negotiations with the Trump administration.
title: EU to Monitor Imports for Signs of Tariff-Related Diversions

description: Bangladesh’s interim government has formally asked the US to postpone a 37% tariff on the South Asian country for three months as it pledges to increase imports of American goods, including liquefied natural gas and key agricultural commodities.
title: Bangladesh’s Leader Asks Trump to Delay Tariffs for Three Months

description: President Donald Trump said he spoke to Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba on Monday and that “tough but fair parameters are being set” for a negotiation over US reciprocal tariffs.
title: Trump Spoke to Ishiba, Set ‘Tough But Fair’ Tariff Talks

description: Russia is reaping the benefit of a pre-war gold-buying spree that’s helped offset roughly a third of the frozen assets in its rainy-day fund.
title: Russia’s Embrace of Gold Eases Loss of Reserves Frozen by War

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has called for strengthened efforts to “fully unleash” the country’s consumption potential to spur growth amid a tariff war with the US.
title: Xi Vows to ‘Fully Unleash’ Consumption in Face of Trump Tariffs

description: Two US independent agency members can return to their jobs while they continue to challenge President Donald Trump’s effort to fire them, a federal appeals court said, reversing an earlier decision that had boosted the president’s push to exercise more control over the government.
title: US Appeals Court Reinstates Agency Members Fired by Trump

description: With panic spreading in markets across the globe, world leaders raced over the weekend to make offers to US President Donald Trump to lower tariffs across the board.
title: Frustrated World Leaders Wonder If Trump Even Wants a Deal

description: President Xi Jinping’s decision to quickly retaliate against Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs sent the world a clear message: If the US wants a trade war, China is ready to fight.
title: Xi Switches to Fight Mode as Trump Trade Deal Looks Unlikely

description: Singapore designated real estate billionaire Robert Ng and three of his children as “politically significant persons” under a law designed to curb foreign influence.
title: Singapore Names Property Tycoon Ng Under Foreign Influence Law

description: Thailand’s strategy to minimize the hit from US tariffs will include pledges to import more goods and ramping up of US investments, and not any outright offer to cut import taxes, according to a government adviser.
title: Thailand Won’t Rush to Reduce Taxes on US Imports, Official Says

description: Elon Musk’s comments in support of a zero-tariff transatlantic trade system are a sign of the billionaire’s weakness and fear, Germany’s outgoing Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck said.
title: Musk Is Showing Signs of Weakness and Fear, Germany’s Habeck Says

description: Europe can find a solution in the trade conflict with the US as long as all member states stick together, according to Luxembourg Deputy Prime Minister Xavier Bettel.
title: United EU Can Find US Trade Compromise, Luxembourg’s Bettel Says

description: President Donald Trump’s campaign to cut spending at every level of the government is creating a series of headaches for its go-to banker: Citigroup Inc.
title: Citi Confronts Trump, DOGE Fallout as US Government’s Go-To Bank

description: A slump in crude oil prompted India to increase taxes on diesel and gasoline, a move that will help the government shore up its revenue.
title: India Hikes Fuel Tax to Boost Income, Keeps Pump Prices Flat

description: Germany wants the European Union to consider using its most powerful tool to retaliate against US President Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: Germany Seeks Strongest EU Trade Tool to Hit Back at US Tariffs

description: Egypt’s currency plunged the most since last year’s devaluation to hit a record low after US President Donald Trump’s tariffs roiled global markets.
title: Egypt’s Pound Plunges to New Low as Trump Tariffs Roil Markets

description: The European Union hasn’t spoken with the Trump administration about any sanctions relief for Russia as part of a ceasefire deal, according to the bloc’s top envoy on the topic.
title: EU Envoy Says No Talks Yet With US on Easing Russia Sanctions

description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon urged a quick resolution to the uncertainties sparked by President Donald Trump’s tariffs and warned against a potentially “disastrous” fragmentation of America’s long-term economic alliances.
title: Jamie Dimon Says Tariff Policy Issues Must Be Resolved Quickly

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Tariff-Stunned Southeast Asia Lines Up to Court Trump

description: President Donald Trump’s much bigger-than-expected tariff hikes increase the urgency of the Republican tax-cut package now in negotiation, while threatening to undermine its boost to business and consumer confidence.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Raise Tax-Cut Stakes With Recession Fears Rising

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s meeting with Donald Trump will give world leaders a sense of how willing the US president is to budge on tariffs.
title: Trump’s Tariff Stance Set for Test in Meeting With Israel’s Netanyahu

description: The UK government needs to consider more perks for businesses and employees if it’s serious about getting the long-term sick back into the country’s workforce, two think-tanks said.
title: UK Urged to Give Companies Incentives to Hire the Long-Term Sick

description: China hit back at plans by both major Australian parties to end a lease on a major port after an upcoming election, an issue that threatens to hurt bilateral ties that have only just recovered from years of tensions.
title: China Urges Australia Not to ‘Politicize’ Port of Darwin Lease

description: Oman is the “main candidate” to mediate any potential nuclear negotiations between Iran and the US, the Iranian foreign ministry said on Monday.
title: Iran Says Oman May Mediate Talks With US if They Take Place

description: The Philippines is considering reducing tariffs on US products in response to President Donald Trump’s sweeping levies including a 17% tariff on Manila’s goods, its trade chief said.
title: Philippines Mulls Cutting Tariffs on US Products, Its Trade Chief Says

description: South Korea is sending its trade minister to the US this week to discuss tariffs after President Donald Trump’s administration hit the Asian ally with a 25% levy, among the highest duties to be imposed on a US security ally.
title: South Korea’s Trade Minister Heads to US After Hit by 25% Tariff

description: The European Union needs to be open to all potential means of retaliation against US tariffs, according to Carlos Cuerpo, the Spanish minister for Economy, Trade and Business.
title: All EU Retaliation Tools Against US Are on Table, Cuerpo Says

description: Israel’s central bank is set to hold interest rates for a 10th consecutive time, as it monitors a weakening shekel and the state of the war-weakened economy, with higher US tariffs only adding to its complicated task.
title: Israel Set to Hold Rates as Trump’s Tariffs and War Hit Shekel

description: Chinese social media users have attacked posts calling for China to accede to Donald Trump’s trade demands, showing defiance after Beijing forcefully retaliated against US tariffs.
title: China Social Media Defiant as Beijing Hits Back at Trump Tariffs

description: Nelson Amenya hoped to help establish better business practices in his native Kenya. But after calling out a lucrative government project, he might not have the option to return home.
title: How One MBA Grad Blew the Whistle on a $2 Billion Deal

description: New Zealand will boost defense spending to more than 2% of gross domestic product, aiming to build a modern, combat-capable military amid rising tensions with China in the Pacific.
title: New Zealand Ramps Up Defense Spending Amid Rising Global Tension

description: Investment in infrastructure and military isn’t straightforward in a country that often struggles to get things done.
title: Germany’s Merz Has a Problem: Can He Spend a Trillion Euros?

description: Singapore’s political leaders warned of a tough road ahead after the US unveiled sweeping global tariffs, a move described by an opposition party as scaremongering.
title: Singapore PM Flags Tariff Alarm, Opposition Calls It Fear Tactic

description: China has expanded its use of critical minerals as a trade weapon with curbs on exports of rare earths, threatening to shake-up the global supply of key materials used widely in high-tech manufacturing from electric vehicles to weaponry.
title: China Deploys Rare Earths as Weapon in Trade War With Trump

description: The danger is of a deployment too small to deter Russia or too big to sustain.
title: Ukraine's 'Reassurance' Force Needs to Go Big — or Go Home

description: South Korea has set June 3 as the tentative date for the next presidential election, Yonhap News reported on Monday, citing an unidentified government official.
title: South Korea Sets June 3 for Presidential Election, Yonhap Says

description: Chinese stocks plunged and bond yields fell toward a record low as investors braced themselves for the fall-out of a spiraling trade conflict between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Chinese Stocks Plunge Amid Growing Fear of Full-Blown Trade War

description: Australia’s center-right opposition made a rare policy backflip in the middle of an election campaign, abandoning a plan for a Trump-style crackdown on work from home provisions for government employees after it appeared to become politically damaging.
title: Australian Opposition Dumps Trump-Style Return to Office Policy

description: China’s objections to new US tariffs stalled a deal to sell off TikTok and keep it operating in the US, President Donald Trump said Sunday.
title: Trump Says China’s Objections to Tariffs Stalled TikTok deal

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said he wants to put together a wide-ranging deal as the basis for negotiations with US President Donald Trump over tariffs.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Aims for Broad Deal With US Over Tariffs
